185559883.review:
Das Game ist genau das, wofür Call of Duty bekannt ist: run & gun.
Ich bin ohne Witz einfach nur durch gerannt und habe alles weggemäht. 

Normalerweise bin ich anspruchsvollere PVP Shooter gewöhnt, bei denen auch Spielmechaniken wichtig sind, aber das Game hier ist wirklich anspruchslos. Die Kampagne ist viel zu kurz und viel zu einfach. Zum einen wird der Spielstand gefühlt jede Minute gespeichert und selbst auf dem höchsten Schwierigkeitsgrad ist das Spiel immer noch zu einfach. Ich habe schon viele Call of Duty Teile über den 2. Weltkrieg gezockt und dieser hier ist der schlechteste Teil, den ich jemals gezockt habe. Die Story ist ok, aber gibt mir gar keine WW2 Feelings. Wer bezüglich Story einen guten Teil sucht, sollte lieber auf Call of Duty 3, World at War oder Finest Hour zugreifen. Die Story von Call of Duty 2 ist wirlich nicht gelungen und selbst mechanisch dafür dann viel zu anspruchslos. Für Leute, die einfach nur reinballern ohne Nachdenken suchen oder ein Slash Shooter Ersatz, sind hier jedoch richtig.

Von mir persönlich bekommt dieses Game keine Empfehlung.

185504846.review: good pew pew game enjoyed it made me excrete

185466233.review:
The Steam Clown Award is an absolutely stupid concept. It serves no real purpose other than to belittle and shame people, offering no constructive value whatsoever. Instead of encouraging positive feedback or meaningful critique, it just reinforces a culture of mockery and pointless trolling. The whole idea is absurd—it’s not even a genuine award, just a ridiculous label meant to humiliate. The fact that it’s even taken seriously by some people is baffling, as it contributes nothing but negativity. In a space where feedback and improvement should be prioritized, the Steam Clown Award is just a senseless, juvenile distraction that serves no beneficial function.

Anyways... an amazing cod for its time, looks surprisingly good for its time, one of the better campaigns if you like old games, no complaints, wait until it goes on sale since you can get it for really cheap.

185412891.review: If you're looking for some quick Call of Duty nostalgia natively on the PC, then this is your game. It follows so much of the same beats as many of the other Call of Duty games of the time. Despite it being quite old by this point, it still hold up better than expected, even coming with ultrawide support. This isn't Spielberg-level writing, nor is it an in-depth gameplay experience, but it sure is a fun game that gets all the basics right. Shooting, completing objectives, and good music to inspire you to fight for the Motherland, the Queen, or for freedom from tyranny. a solid 7.5/10

185248209.review:
[h1]The start of the Xbox 360/PS3 Golden Age[/h1]

Call of Duty 2 is what, in my mind, cemented the Call of Duty franchise into history. COD2 massively improves upon just about everything from the older games and it still holds up incredibly well. The graphics, weapon animations and motion captured animations are still impressive for a game from 2005. Keep in mind that this released after Half-Life 2 so to be able to survive that is a major achievement.

The Russian and American campaigns are gold with the British campaign being a lot less interesting. The Russian campaign is the highlight to me as I feel like the setting, minor narrative parts and level design is peak, however the American campaign is also a strong contender. The British campaign suffers in level design and is the least visually interesting, you end up fighting in a lot of barren sandy streets. Compared to the other 2 campaigns the British one doesn't hold up at all, its almost as if they ran out of time.

Call of Duty 2 is not just visually impressive, the gameplay is all there and the almost open-ended level design is amazing for the time. The D-Day mission still stands as one of the best in all of gaming due to it being so open, while it certainly has scripted sequences, once you reach the top of the cliff you're more or less free to go in any direction and into any trench to avoid the artillery. The ally and enemy NPCs actually fight each other and can die from just about anything. Allied NPCs really add a lot to the atmosphere and always existed to make you feel less like a one man army (even though you are). COD2s open-ended level design and freedom is what really stands out, there are numerous points where the levels open up, allowing you to flank and not telling you exactly where to go, this is something that not even Call of Duty: World at War managed to achieve. Every weapon in the game is useful and utilised, even the smoke grenades.

Overall, this is absolutely worth playing, obviously its aged but no where near to a point where its not enjoyable.

184614105.review:
[h1] Call of Duty 2 - A Classic Shooter with Explosive Memories (10/10) [/h1]

[b] Call of Duty [/b] The game that took us to the frontlines of World War II, where every grenade felt personal, and every bullet sounded like a symphony of chaos. The gameplay is pure, unadulterated action, with tight controls, iconic maps, and combat so intense it’ll have you yelling “Grenade!” even in your sleep.

And the music? It's like a military march right into your nostalgic heart. Every epic moment is backed by a soundtrack that gets you pumped up, whether you're storming Omaha Beach or taking cover behind a barrel. It’s the kind of game where you’ll hear the music in your head for days (and maybe get PTSD from the constant explosions).

Now, speaking of memories. [b] Call of Duty 2 [/b] will forever be tied to [b] Renáta [/b], my ex-girlfriend (who, despite us not being together anymore, I’ll always remember fondly). She was a force of nature in PvP, yelling at enemies like they could hear her across the screen. We may have broken up, but I’ll always cherish the times she took out entire squads while muttering something about "noobs" under her breath. Ah, memories… and enemies that didn’t stand a chance.

10/10. Classic gameplay, explosive moments, and memories that’ll last longer than your killstreaks. Get ready to dive in and maybe yell at some enemies yourself.

184399392.review:
[h1] CALL OF DUTY 2 [/h1]

İlk oyundan beri anlattıkları yetmezmiş gibi bu oyunda da İkinci Dünya Savaşı'nı anlatmışlar fakat şunu söyleyebilirim ki Call of Duty 2 bu konsepti işleyen gelmiş geçmiş en iyi oyun olabilir. Her zamanki gibi bu oyunda da tam anlamıyla bir hikaye yok, anlatı yine üç ayrı cephe üzerinden ilerliyor. Bu her ne kadar gerçekçiliği destekliyor gibi dursa da oyuncuyu hikaye açısından tam anlamıyla içine çekmeyi başaramıyor. Anlatılan taraflar ise yine klasik olarak Sovyetler, Britanya ve Amerikan birliği.

[b] SOVYET CEPHESİ [/b]
13. Muhafız Tüfek Tümeni'nden Er Vasili Koslov olarak oynadığımız ilk bölümde Moskova'nın içine doğru ilerleyen Alman birliklerine karşı direniş gösteriyoruz. Ardından ise yıllar süren Sovyet direnişi, gerek Stalingrad'da bulunan Alman üslerine saldırı düzenlememiz ile gerekse de direniş güçlerinin iletişim ağlarını yeniden yapılandırarak demiryolu hattını tekrar ele geçirmemiz ile anlatılıyor.

[b] BRİTANYA CEPHESİ [/b]
İkinci bölümde ise Kaptan Price'ın komutası altında bulunan 7. Zırhlı Tümen'den Çavuş John Davis olarak oynuyoruz. Kasım 1942 tarihinde başlayan bu bölümde, Kuzey Afrika'da bulunan Alman-Afrika Kolordusu'na karşı işgal girişiminde bulunuyoruz. Ardından ise El-Alameyn Muharebesi'ne ön hazırlık olması adına birçok Alman karargahını ele geçiriyoruz.

[b] AMERİKAN CEPHESİ [/b]
Amerikan'nın 2. Korucu Taburu'ndan Onbaşı Bill Taylor olarak oynadığımız son bölüm ise Fransa'nın Normandiya bölgesinde bulunan Calvados sahiline düzenlenen Pointe du Hoc Harekatı'nı konu alıyor. Alman birliklerini geri püskürterek Fransa'nın büyük bir bölümünü özgürleştiriyoruz ve Normandiya Çıkarması'na ön ayak oluyoruz.

Call of Duty 2, gerçekten de yapılmış en iyi İkinci Dünya Savaşı oyunu olabilir. Oynanış açışından çıktığı yıl 2005 için kusursuza yakın bir deneyim sunuyor ki şuan günümüzde bile bu oyun hiç yaşlanmamış dedirtiyor. Ayrıca savaş atmosferini de dibine kadar hissettiriyor. Rusya'nın soğuk ve karlı atmosferi, Kuzey Afrika'nın ıssız çölleri ve Fransa'nın ufak ama yeşil yerleşkelerine kadar akılda kalıcı onlarca bölüm var. Oyun döngüsünü de ufak birkaç değişiklik ile sadece önüne çıkan adamı öldür konseptinin ötesine taşımayı başarmışlar.

[b] SONUÇ [/b]
Steam dolar kuruna geçmeden önce oyunu gönül rahatlığı ile önerebilirdim fakat Call of Duty 2 şuan 20 dolar ve bu fiyat 4-5 saat süren bir oyun için oldukça fazla. Yine de indirim dönemlerinde 10 dolar altına vesaire denk getirdiğiniz kesinlikle alıp oynamanız gerektiğini düşünüyorum. Çünkü, başta da dediğim gibi İkinci Dünya Savaşı'nı bu denli anlatabilen ve yaşatabilen başka bir oyun olduğunu düşünmüyorum.

[h1] İNCELEME PUANI: 85 / 100 [/h1]

184364556.review:
Call of Duty 2 brilliantly builds on the original, offering an enhanced World War II experience that FPS fans shouldn't miss. The introduction of regenerative health keeps the action fluid, and the upgraded graphics bring every battlefield to life with stunning detail. Despite the numerous missions, each one is crafted to keep you engaged, making the journey worth every minute.

Playing Call of Duty 2 right after the first game showcases the franchise's impressive evolution. i Highly recommend anyone who is looking to see how far Call of Duty has come!
